result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvester Tremaine Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conccurent without prejudcie to consecutive if revoked.
Court does not object to Probation being terminated after 1 year if conditions are met.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung DF ATTY: Christopher Stephen Petros DF: Sylvester Tremaine Jones appeared. Case called at 9:04. Includes 15CM98, 16CM114. Atty. Petros updates the court. ADA Hartung agrees.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended  charge in 15CM98 to DC without a domestic inhancer and G to 16CM114. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended charge to DC without the domestic enhancer in 15CM98 (947.01) and guilty of 16CM114. On motion of the State without objecton, Crt dismisses 16CM33 which was previously dismissed and now is dismissed with prejudice.  Sentencing arguments. Crt orders:
On 15CM98
60 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED.
Court notes 4 days credit against any ultimate sentence. 
18 months probation with conditions:
Court does not object to probation being terminated after a year if conditions have been met. 
- DE is to have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with K. Denver the term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent. 
- AODA and any recommended follow through by agent or additional assessments.
- 15 hrs of community service.
- Random and regular testing.
- Seek and maintain work and seek work or school.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Costs of $243.00
Apply bond on file
DA's office to check on money siezed and have them forwarded to the COC office to be credited. Any difference shall be paid through probation. 

On 16CM114
90 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED consecutive to 15CM98
- Costs of $243.00.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge of $200.00.
Plea hearing on June 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $750.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.


-Defendant to have a UA test before release and must be negative to be released from jail.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Report every  Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or if a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
